taskbody.prereq: The following steps assume that you have a fragment or module model opened in the Editor area that contains a tabbed pane.

step.cmd: Select the tabbed pane and go to the Properties View.
Set the Hide empty tabs property to True.
step.stepresult: The tabbed pane is treated as dynamic.

step.cmd: Select the dataset attributes from the list to use for filtering data in the Tabs filtered by attribute property.
Click on the first tab of the tabbed pane. Ensure that the first tab has the Hide if empty property set to False.
For each tab you want to be removed at runtime when empty, select the tab and set the filter value in the Filter: keep value equals to property.
step.stepresult: The task is finished in Page Designer.

step.cmd: Ensure in your pageflow(s) that the "reload" transition exists in the View state displaying this module. This is required by the events that Design Studio generates.

Set the action on the "reload" transition that is required by the filtering process. For more information, refer to the Triple'A Plus Web PMS Process Reference Guide that is delivered in the Triple'A Plus software package.
